	Wives, submit yourselves to your own husbands as you do to the Lord. This follows mutual submission. Wives submit to husbands as part of mutual honor.

	Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ loved the church and gave himself up for her. Husbands love sacrificially. Self-giving love. Christ-like love.

	Children, obey your parents in the Lord, for this is right. Children honor parents. Fathers, don't exasperate children. Mutual respect in families.

	Slaves, obey your earthly masters with respect and fear. Even difficult relationships can honor Christ through respectful behavior.

	Mutual submission creates healthy relationships. Everyone serves. Everyone honors. Everyone submits to Christ through serving others.

	Jesus, I submit to others out of reverence for You! Help me honor You by honoring others. Let mutual submission create healthy relationships that glorify You. I serve others as service to You! Amen.
devotionals.books: Submit to one another out of reverence for Christ. Wives, submit yourselves to your own husbands as you do to the Lord. Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ loved the church and gave himself up for her. - Ephesians 5:21-22, 25

devotionals.title: Be Strong in the Lord
devotionals.devotionalText:
Finally, be strong in the Lord and in his mighty power. Put on the full armor of God, so that you can take your stand against the devil's schemes. Be strong in the Lord. Wear His armor. Stand against Satan's schemes.

	Be strong in the Lord. Not strong in yourself. Strong in Him. His strength, not yours. His power, not your ability.

	And in his mighty power. Mighty power is available to you. Not weak power. Not limited power. Mighty, unlimited, supernatural power.

	Put on the full armor of God. God provides armor. Spiritual protection. Divine covering. Don't fight nakedâ€”wear His armor.

	So that you can take your stand. Stand firm. Don't retreat. Don't run. Stand your ground in His strength.

	Against the devil's schemes. Satan has schemes. Strategies. Plans to defeat you. But God's armor protects against all schemes.

	For our struggle is not against flesh and blood, but against spiritual forces of evil. Your real enemy isn't peopleâ€”it's spiritual forces.

	Therefore put on the full armor of God. Because the battle is spiritual, you need spiritual armor. Full armor, not partial.

	You don't fight in your own strength against spiritual enemies. You fight in God's strength with God's armor.

	Father, I'm strong in You and Your mighty power! I put on Your full armor to stand against the devil's schemes. My battle is spiritual, so I fight with spiritual weapons. Make me strong in You! Amen.
devotionals.books: Finally, be strong in the Lord and in his mighty power. Put on the full armor of God, so that you can take your stand against the devil's schemes. For our struggle is not against flesh and blood, but against the spiritual forces of evil in the heavenly realms. - Ephesians 6:10-12

devotionals.title: The Armor of God
devotionals.devotionalText:
Stand firm then, with the belt of truth buckled around your waist, with the breastplate of righteousness in place. Truth and righteousnessâ€”your foundation and protection.

	Stand firm then. Because you have armor, stand firm. Don't waver. Don't retreat. Stand your ground in God's equipment.

	With the belt of truth buckled around your waist. Truth holds everything together. Like a soldier's belt, truth secures all other armor pieces.

	With the breastplate of righteousness in place. Righteousness protects your heart. Not your righteousnessâ€”Christ's righteousness covering you.

	With your feet fitted with the readiness that comes from the gospel of peace. Ready feet. Peace gospel shoes. Always ready to share good news.

	In addition to all this, take up the shield of faith. Faith deflects Satan's attacks. Every fiery dart is extinguished by faith.

	With which you can extinguish all the flaming arrows of the evil one. All arrows. Not some. Faith stops every attack Satan fires.

	Take the helmet of salvation and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God. Salvation protects your mind. God's word is your weapon.

	You're fully equipped for spiritual warfare. Truth, righteousness, peace, faith, salvation, God's word.

	Father, I stand firm in Your armor! Truth around my waist, righteousness protecting my heart, peace on my feet, faith as my shield, salvation as my helmet, Your word as my sword. I'm fully equipped! Amen.
devotionals.books: Stand firm then, with the belt of truth buckled around your waist, with the breastplate of righteousness in place, and with your feet fitted with the readiness that comes from the gospel of peace. In addition to all this, take up the shield of faith, with which you can extinguish all the flaming arrows of the evil one. Take the helmet of salvation and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God. - Ephesians 6:14-17

devotionals.title: Pray in the Spirit
devotionals.devotionalText:
And pray in the Spirit on all occasions with all kinds of prayers and requests. With this in mind, be alert and always keep on praying for all the Lord's people. Pray in the Spirit. All occasions. All kinds. All people.

	Pray in the Spirit. Not just with your mind, but in the Spirit. Spirit-led prayer. Spirit-empowered prayer. Spirit-guided prayer.

	On all occasions. Not just crisis occasions. All occasionsâ€”good times, bad times, normal times. Constant prayer connection.

	With all kinds of prayers and requests. All kindsâ€”worship, petition, intercession, thanksgiving. Variety in prayer. Different prayers for different needs.

	With this in mind, be alert. Stay awake spiritually. Stay aware. Prayer requires alertness. Don't sleepwalk through spiritual battle.

	Always keep on praying. Not sometimes. Always. Continuous prayer. Ongoing conversation with God. Prayer as lifestyle.

	For all the Lord's people. Not just for yourself. For all believers. Your prayers cover the whole body of Christ.

	Pray also for me, that whenever I speak, words may be given me. Even apostles need prayer. Everyone needs intercession.

	Prayer is your spiritual warfare weapon. In the Spirit, on all occasions, for all people.

	Holy Spirit, I pray in You on all occasions! Help me stay alert and always keep praying for all the Lord's people. Give me all kinds of prayers and requests. I'm a praying person! Amen.
devotionals.books: And pray in the Spirit on all occasions with all kinds of prayers and requests. With this in mind, be alert and always keep on praying for all the Lord's people. Pray also for me, that whenever I speak, words may be given me so that I will fearlessly make known the mystery of the gospel. - Ephesians 6:18-19

devotionals.title: Grace and Peace
devotionals.devotionalText:
Peace to the brothers and sisters, and love with faith from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. Grace to all who love our Lord Jesus Christ with an undying love. Peace, love, faith, graceâ€”all yours.

	Peace to the brothers and sisters. Peace is yours. Not the world's peace that depends on circumstances. Divine peace that transcends understanding.

	And love with faith from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. Love and faith go together. Both come from the Father and Jesus. Divine love enables divine faith.

	Grace to all who love our Lord Jesus Christ. Grace for lovers of Jesus. If you love Him, grace is yours. Not earnedâ€”given to those who love.

	With an undying love. Not temporary love. Not conditional love. Undying loveâ€”permanent, eternal, unending love for Jesus.

	May God himself, the God of peace, sanctify you through and through. Peace sanctifies. God of peace makes you holy through and through.

	May your whole spirit, soul and body be kept blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ. Complete preservationâ€”spirit, soul, body. Total sanctification.

	You have peace, love, faith, and grace. All from God the Father and Lord Jesus Christ. All because you love Him with undying love.

	Father, I receive Your peace, love, faith, and grace! Thank You for sanctifying me through and through. Keep my spirit, soul, and body blameless. I love Jesus with undying love and receive Your abundant grace! Amen.
devotionals.books: Peace to the brothers and sisters, and love with faith from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. Grace to all who love our Lord Jesus Christ with an undying love. - Ephesians 6:23-24

devotionals.title: Living Your True Identity
devotionals.devotionalText:
I have been crucified with Christ and I no longer live, but Christ lives in me. The life I now live in the body, I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me. Crucified with Christ. Christ lives in you. This is your identity.

	I have been crucified with Christ. Past tense. When Christ was crucified, you were crucified with Him. Your old self died on the cross.

	I no longer live. The person you used to be is dead. That life is over. That identity is finished. You no longer live that old life.

	But Christ lives in me. New life. Christ's life. He doesn't just help you liveâ€”He lives your life through you. His life becomes your life.

	The life I now live in the body, I live by faith. Your current life is lived by faith. Not by sight. Not by feeling. By faith in Christ.

	In the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me. Personal love. He loved YOU. He gave Himself for YOU. This is individual, intimate love.

	You're not trying to live the Christian life. Christ is living His life through you. You're not the one livingâ€”He is.

	This is the secret of the Christian lifeâ€”not you living for Christ, but Christ living through you.

	Jesus, I'm crucified with You, and You live in me! The life I now live, I live by faith in You who loved me and gave Yourself for me. I don't liveâ€”You live through me. This is my true identity! Amen.
devotionals.books: I have been crucified with Christ and I no longer live, but Christ lives in me. The life I now live in the body, I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me. - Galatians 2:20

devotionals.title: Freedom in Christ
devotionals.devotionalText:
It is for freedom that Christ has set us free. Stand firm, then, and do not let yourselves be burdened again by a yoke of slavery. Free to be free. Stand firm in freedom. Don't return to slavery.

	It is for freedom that Christ has set us free. Freedom is the purpose. Not rules. Not regulations. Not religious performance. Freedom.

	Stand firm, then. Don't waver in your freedom. Don't compromise your liberty. Don't give up what Christ died to give you.

	Do not let yourselves be burdened again by a yoke of slavery. Don't go back to bondage. Don't return to performance-based religion. Stay free.

	You, my brothers and sisters, were called to be free. Called to freedom. Not called to bondage. Not called to rules. Called to liberty.

	But do not use your freedom to indulge the flesh. Freedom isn't license to sin. It's power not to sin. Freedom serves love, not lust.

	Rather, serve one another humbly in love. Use your freedom to serve. Love liberates you to love others. Freedom serves.

	Christ set you free to live free. Not free to sin, but free from sin. Not free to be selfish, but free to serve.

	Jesus, You set me free for freedom! I stand firm in this liberty and won't return to slavery. Help me use my freedom to serve others in love. I'm free to be free! Amen.
devotionals.books: It is for freedom that Christ has set us free. Stand firm, then, and do not let yourselves be burdened again by a yoke of slavery. You, my brothers and sisters, were called to be free. But do not use your freedom to indulge the flesh; rather, serve one another humbly in love. - Galatians 5:1, 13

devotionals.title: Walk by the Spirit
devotionals.devotionalText:
So I say, walk by the Spirit, and you will not gratify the desires of the flesh. For the flesh desires what is contrary to the Spirit, and the Spirit what is contrary to the flesh. Walk by the Spirit. Flesh and Spirit are opposites.

	Walk by the Spirit. Step by step. Decision by decision. Moment by moment. Let the Spirit guide your walk through life.

	And you will not gratify the desires of the flesh. Walking by the Spirit automatically defeats fleshly desires. You don't fight fleshâ€”you follow Spirit.

	The flesh desires what is contrary to the Spirit. Flesh and Spirit want opposite things. They're in conflict. They can't coexist.

	And the Spirit what is contrary to the flesh. The Spirit wants what opposes flesh. Holy desires versus fleshly desires. Life versus death.

	They are in conflict with each other, so that you are not to do whatever you want. Internal conflict is normal. You feel the tension between flesh and Spirit.

	But if you are led by the Spirit, you are not under the law. Spirit-led people aren't rule-driven. Grace guides, not law.

	The key to victory isn't fighting fleshâ€”it's following Spirit. Walk by the Spirit, and flesh loses its power.

	Holy Spirit, I walk by You! Lead me step by step, and I won't gratify fleshly desires. I'm not under law but under grace. Guide my walk, and I'll follow Your lead. I walk by the Spirit! Amen.
devotionals.books: So I say, walk by the Spirit, and you will not gratify the desires of the flesh. For the flesh desires what is contrary to the Spirit, and the Spirit what is contrary to the flesh. They are in conflict with each other, so that you are not to do whatever you want. But if you are led by the Spirit, you are not under the law. - Galatians 5:16-18

devotionals.title: The Fruit of the Spirit
devotionals.devotionalText:
But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, forbearance, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness and self-control. Against such things there is no law. This is what the Spirit produces in youâ€”fruit that no law can condemn.

	The fruit of the Spirit. Not fruits, plural. Fruit, singular. One fruit with nine flavors. The Spirit produces all of these in you.

	Loveâ€”the foundation. Joyâ€”supernatural happiness. Peaceâ€”calm in chaos. These flow from the Spirit, not circumstances.

	Forbearanceâ€”patience with people. Kindnessâ€”tender care. Goodnessâ€”moral excellence. The Spirit makes you better with others.

	Faithfulnessâ€”reliability. Gentlenessâ€”strength under control. Self-controlâ€”Spirit-controlled emotions. Character that reflects Christ.

	Against such things there is no law. No law opposes these qualities. No rule condemns this fruit. Law can't improve on what the Spirit produces.

	Those who belong to Christ Jesus have crucified the flesh with its passions and desires. You've already dealt with the fleshâ€”it's crucified.

	You don't produce this fruit through effort. The Spirit produces it through you. Stay connected to Him, and fruit happens naturally.

	Holy Spirit, produce Your fruit in me! Love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, self-controlâ€”let them all flow from my life. I belong to Christ, and Your fruit proves it! Amen.
devotionals.books: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, forbearance, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness and self-control. Against such things there is no law. Those who belong to Christ Jesus have crucified the flesh with its passions and desires. - Galatians 5:22-24

devotionals.title: Keep in Step with the Spirit
devotionals.devotionalText:
Since we live by the Spirit, let us keep in step with the Spirit. Let us not become conceited, provoking and envying each other. Live by the Spirit. Walk in step with Him. No pride, no envy.

	Since we live by the Spirit. This is fact. You live by the Spirit. Your life source is spiritual, not natural. The Spirit gives you life.

	Let us keep in step with the Spirit. Match His pace. Follow His lead. Stay in rhythm with Him. Don't run ahead or lag behind.

	Let us not become conceited. Pride breaks fellowship. Conceit destroys unity. The Spirit produces humility, not arrogance.

	Provoking and envying each other. Don't provoke others to jealousy. Don't envy what others have. The Spirit gives contentment.

	Brothers and sisters, if someone is caught in a sin, you who live by the Spirit should restore that person gently. Restore, don't condemn. Gently, not harshly.

	But watch yourselves, or you also may be tempted. Humility remembers you're not above falling. Grace remembers you need mercy too.

	Carry each other's burdens, and in this way you will fulfill the law of Christ. Love carries burdens. The Spirit enables burden-bearing.

	Keep in step with the Spirit. He sets the pace for your life. Follow His lead.

	Holy Spirit, I keep in step with You! Help me match Your pace, follow Your lead, stay in Your rhythm. Remove conceit and envy from my heart. Help me restore others gently and carry their burdens. I walk in step with You! Amen.
devotionals.books: Since we live by the Spirit, let us keep in step with the Spirit. Let us not become conceited, provoking and envying each other. Brothers and sisters, if someone is caught in a sin, you who live by the Spirit should restore that person gently. - Galatians 5:25-6:1

devotionals.title: You Reap What You Sow
devotionals.devotionalText:
Do not be deceived: God cannot be mocked. A man reaps what he sows. Whoever sows to please their flesh, from the flesh will reap destruction; whoever sows to please the Spirit, from the Spirit will reap eternal life. Sowing and reapingâ€”spiritual law that never fails.

	God cannot be mocked. You can't fool God. You can't cheat the system. Spiritual laws work every time. What you sow, you reap.

	A man reaps what he sows. This is agricultural law applied spiritually. Plant corn, get corn. Plant weeds, get weeds. Guaranteed.

	Whoever sows to please their flesh. Sowing to flesh means feeding fleshly desires. Living for self. Pursuing sin. This produces destruction.

	From the flesh will reap destruction. Flesh produces death. Always. Eventually. Inevitably. Sowing to flesh never produces life.

	Whoever sows to please the Spirit. Sowing to Spirit means feeding spiritual desires. Living for God. Pursuing righteousness. This produces life.

	From the Spirit will reap eternal life. Spirit produces life. Always. Abundantly. Eternally. Sowing to Spirit always produces life.

	Let us not become weary in doing good, for at the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do not give up. Keep sowing good. Harvest is coming.

	You're sowing something every day. Make sure you're sowing to the Spirit, not the flesh.

	Father, I sow to the Spirit, not the flesh! Help me plant seeds that produce eternal life, not destruction. I won't grow weary in doing good because harvest is coming. I reap what I sowâ€”so I sow to the Spirit! Amen.
devotionals.books: Do not be deceived: God cannot be mocked. A man reaps what he sows. Whoever sows to please their flesh, from the flesh will reap destruction; whoever sows to please the Spirit, from the Spirit will reap eternal life. - Galatians 6:7-8

devotionals.title: Boast in the Cross
devotionals.devotionalText:
May I never boast except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through which the world has been crucified to me, and I to the world. Boast only in the cross. The world is dead to you. You're dead to the world.

	May I never boast except in the cross. The cross is your only boasting point. Not achievements. Not accomplishments. The cross alone.

	Of our Lord Jesus Christ. The cross isn't just a symbolâ€”it's where Jesus died for you. Personal. Powerful. Permanent.

	Through which the world has been crucified to me. The world's value system is dead to you. Its applause doesn't move you. Its rejection doesn't define you.

	And I to the world. You're dead to the world's system. You don't live for its approval. You don't fear its rejection. You're dead to it.

	Neither circumcision nor uncircumcision means anything. Religious rituals don't matter. External marks don't count. Performance doesn't save.

	What counts is the new creation. Being new in Christ is everything. New nature. New identity. New life. This is what matters.

	The cross ended your relationship with the world's system. Now you live as a new creation.

	Jesus, I boast only in Your cross! Through it, the world is dead to me and I'm dead to the world. I don't need its approval or fear its rejection. I'm a new creation, and that's all that matters! Amen.
devotionals.books: May I never boast except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through which the world has been crucified to me, and I to the world. Neither circumcision nor uncircumcision means anything; what counts is the new creation. - Galatians 6:14-15

devotionals.title: Blessed in Christ
devotionals.devotionalText:
Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us in the heavenly realms with every spiritual blessing in Christ. Every spiritual blessing is yours. Past tense. Already blessed.

	Who has blessed us. Not will bless. Has blessed. The blessing already happened. You're not waiting for blessingâ€”you have it.

	In the heavenly realms. Your blessings are spiritual, eternal, heavenly. Not just earthly blessings, but heavenly treasures.

	With every spiritual blessing. Not some blessings. Every blessing. Complete. Total. Nothing held back. Every spiritual blessing is yours.

	In Christ. Your blessings are in Christ. Because you're in Him, every blessing with His name on it has your name on it too.

	For he chose us in him before the creation of the world. Before time began, God chose you. Your selection preceded creation.

	To be holy and blameless in his sight. Chosen for holiness. Selected for blamelessness. This is your destinyâ€”holy and blameless.

	In love he predestined us for adoption to sonship. Love motivated your adoption. You're not just savedâ€”you're adopted. Full family member.

	You lack no spiritual blessing. Everything you need for spiritual life is already yours in Christ.

	Father, You've blessed me with every spiritual blessing in Christ! I'm not waiting for blessingâ€”I already have it all. Thank You for choosing me before creation to be holy and blameless. I'm blessed! Amen.
devotionals.books: Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us in the heavenly realms with every spiritual blessing in Christ. For he chose us in him before the creation of the world to be holy and blameless in his sight. - Ephesians 1:3-4

devotionals.title: Adopted as Sons
devotionals.devotionalText:
In love he predestined us for adoption to sonship through Jesus Christ, in accordance with his pleasure and will. Adoption was God's plan. His pleasure. His will. You're His adopted child.

	In love. Love motivated your adoption. Not obligation. Not pity. Pure love drove God to adopt you as His child.

	He predestined us for adoption. Your adoption was planned before you were born. God always intended to make you His child.

	To sonship through Jesus Christ. Full sonship. Complete rights. Total inheritance. You're not a second-class childâ€”you're a full heir.

	In accordance with his pleasure and will. God wanted to adopt you. It pleased Him. It was His will. You're wanted.

	To the praise of his glorious grace, which he has freely given us in the One he loves. Grace freely given. Not earned. Not deserved. Freely given in Christ.

	In him we have redemption through his blood. Redemption purchased. Freedom bought. Liberation secured through Jesus' blood.

	The forgiveness of sins, in accordance with the riches of God's grace. Complete forgiveness. According to rich grace, not poor mercy.

	You're not an orphan. You're adopted. Full rights. Complete inheritance. Permanent family.

	Father, You adopted me as Your child! This was Your pleasure, Your will, Your plan. Thank You for redemption through Jesus' blood and forgiveness according to Your rich grace. I'm Your adopted child with full rights! Amen.
devotionals.books: In love he predestined us for adoption to sonship through Jesus Christ, in accordance with his pleasure and willâ€”to the praise of his glorious grace, which he has freely given us in the One he loves. In him we have redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of sins, in accordance with the riches of God's grace. - Ephesians 1:4-7

devotionals.title: Sealed with the Spirit
devotionals.devotionalText:
And you also were included in Christ when you heard the message of truth, the gospel of your salvation. When you believed, you were marked in him with a seal, the promised Holy Spirit. Sealed. Marked. Guaranteed. The Spirit is your seal.

	You also were included in Christ. Included. Not excluded. You're in Christ. Part of God's family. Fully included.

	When you heard the message of truth. Truth came to you. The gospel reached you. Good news found you. Truth set you free.

	The gospel of your salvation. Personal salvation. Your rescue. Your deliverance. The gospel saved YOU specifically.

	When you believed. The moment of faith. The instant of trust. When you said yes to Jesus, everything changed.

	You were marked in him with a seal. God's seal on you. His mark of ownership. His stamp of authenticity. You're genuine.

	The promised Holy Spirit. The Spirit is your seal. He marks you as God's. He guarantees your inheritance. He secures your salvation.

	Who is a deposit guaranteeing our inheritance. The Spirit is your down payment. Your guarantee. Your proof of coming inheritance.

	You're sealed, marked, and guaranteed. The Holy Spirit is your proof of belonging to God.

	Holy Spirit, You are my seal! Thank You for marking me as God's own possession. You guarantee my inheritance and secure my salvation. I'm sealed, marked, and guaranteed by You! Amen.
devotionals.books: And you also were included in Christ when you heard the message of truth, the gospel of your salvation. When you believed, you were marked in him with a seal, the promised Holy Spirit, who is a deposit guaranteeing our inheritance. - Ephesians 1:13-14

devotionals.title: The Hope of His Calling
devotionals.devotionalText:
I pray that the eyes of your heart may be enlightened in order that you may know the hope to which he has called you, the riches of his glorious inheritance in his holy people. Your heart has eyes. They need enlightening. There's hope in your calling.

	The eyes of your heart. Your heart sees. Spiritual sight. Inner vision. Your heart perceives spiritual reality.

	May be enlightened. Illuminated. Opened. Awakened. Your heart's eyes need God's light to see spiritual truth.

	That you may know the hope to which he has called you. Your calling brings hope. Specific hope. Personal hope. Hope attached to God's call on your life.

	The riches of his glorious inheritance in his holy people. Rich inheritance. Glorious wealth. God's inheritance IN you, not just FOR you.

	And his incomparably great power for us who believe. Incomparable power. Unmatched strength. Unlimited ability. For believers. For you.

	That power is the same as the mighty strength he exerted when he raised Christ from the dead. Resurrection power. Death-defeating strength. The same power that raised Jesus works in you.

	Your calling comes with hope, inheritance, and resurrection power. Open your heart's eyes to see it.

	Father, open the eyes of my heart! Help me see the hope of my calling, the riches of my inheritance, and Your incomparably great power working in me. The same power that raised Christ works in me! Amen.
devotionals.books: I pray that the eyes of your heart may be enlightened in order that you may know the hope to which he has called you, the riches of his glorious inheritance in his holy people, and his incomparably great power for us who believe. - Ephesians 1:18-19

devotionals.title: Far Above All Rule
devotionals.devotionalText:
And seated him at his right hand in the heavenly realms, far above all rule and authority, power and dominion, and every name that is invoked. Jesus is seated far above everything. And you're seated with Him.

	Seated him at his right hand. Position of honor. Place of authority. Right hand represents power and privilege.

	In the heavenly realms. Not earthly positionâ€”heavenly position. Spiritual location. Eternal placement.

	Far above all rule and authority. Not just aboveâ€”FAR above. Every earthly rule. Every spiritual authority. Jesus is higher.

	Power and dominion. Every power structure. Every dominion system. Jesus outranks them all. His position is supreme.

	And every name that is invoked. Every name mentioned. Every title given. Jesus' name is above them all.

	Not only in the present age but also in the one to come. His supremacy is permanent. Present and future. Now and forever.

	And God placed all things under his feet. Everything is under Jesus. All things subjected to Him. Complete authority.

	Because you're in Christ, you share His position. You're seated with Him far above all.

	Jesus, You're seated far above all rule and authority! And I'm seated with You! Thank You that Your name is above every name. All things are under Your feet, and I share Your victorious position! Amen.
devotionals.books: And seated him at his right hand in the heavenly realms, far above all rule and authority, power and dominion, and every name that is invoked, not only in the present age but also in the one to come. And God placed all things under his feet. - Ephesians 1:20-22

devotionals.title: The Mystery of His Will
devotionals.devotionalText:
He made known to us the mystery of his will according to his good pleasure, which he purposed in Christ. God reveals mysteries to you. His will is no longer hidden.

	He made known to us the mystery. What was hidden is revealed. What was secret is disclosed. Mystery becomes revelation.

	Of his will. God's will isn't mysterious to you. He wants you to know it. He reveals it. He makes it known.

	According to his good pleasure. God enjoys revealing His will to you. It pleases Him to show you His plans.

	Which he purposed in Christ. Everything centers in Christ. God's will, God's purpose, God's planâ€”all in Jesus.

	To bring unity to all things in heaven and on earth under Christ. God's ultimate planâ€”everything united under Jesus.

	In him we were also chosen, having been predestined according to the plan of him who works out everything. Chosen. Predestined. Planned.

	In conformity with the purpose of his will. God's will has purpose. His plan has intention. You fit into His purposeful will.

	God doesn't hide His will from you. He reveals it, and it centers on Christ.

	Father, thank You for revealing the mystery of Your will! You don't hide Your plans from me. Help me understand Your will that centers on Christ. I'm chosen according to Your purposeful plan! Amen.
devotionals.books: He made known to us the mystery of his will according to his good pleasure, which he purposed in Christ, to be put into effect when the times reach their fulfillmentâ€”to bring unity to all things in heaven and on earth under Christ. - Ephesians 1:9-10

devotionals.title: Made Us Alive Together
devotionals.devotionalText:
But God, who is rich in mercy, because of His great love with which He loved us, even when we were dead in trespasses, made us alive together with Christ. From death to life. From hopeless to alive. All because of love.

	But God. Two of the most powerful words in Scripture. When all seemed lost, BUT GOD intervened.

	Who is rich in mercy. Not poor in mercy. Rich. Abundant. Overflowing. More mercy than you could ever need.

	Because of His great love with which He loved us. Great love. Not small, not average. Great, overwhelming, extraordinary love.

	Even when we were dead in trespasses. While we were spiritually dead. Not after we improved. While we were dead.

	Made us alive together with Christ. Past tense. Already done. You're not getting aliveâ€”you ARE alive. With Christ.

	By grace you have been saved. Grace did it. Not works. Not effort. Not religion. Grace saved you.

	You were deadâ€”hopelessly, completely dead. But God's great love and rich mercy made you alive.

	Father, You are rich in mercy! Because of Your great love, You made me alive with Christ even when I was dead in sin. Thank You for this gift of life. By grace I'm saved! Amen.
devotionals.books: But God, who is rich in mercy, because of His great love with which He loved us, even when we were dead in trespasses, made us alive together with Christ (by grace you have been saved). - Ephesians 2:4-5

devotionals.title: Christ Formed in You
devotionals.devotionalText:
My dear children, for whom I am again in the pains of childbirth until Christ is formed in you. Christ is being formed in you. Not just with youâ€”IN you.

	Until Christ is formed in you. Formation takes time. Like a baby forming in the womb. Christ is taking shape in you.

	This isn't about you becoming better. It's about Christ being formed. His character. His nature. His life formed in yours.

	I am again in the pains of childbirth. Paul travailed for this. Spiritual formation requires spiritual labor. It's worth the pain.

	It is no longer I who live, but Christ lives in me. This is the goalâ€”Christ so formed in you that He lives through you.

	The life I now live in the flesh I live by faith in the Son of God. Your life is now lived by faith. Christ in you lives through you.

	Who loved me and gave Himself for me. Personal love. Individual sacrifice. He loved YOU and gave Himself for YOU.

	Christ is being formed in you daily. You're becoming more like Him as He takes shape in you.

	Jesus, be formed in me! Take shape in my character, my thoughts, my actions. I want You so formed in me that You live through me. Continue Your formation work in me! Amen.
devotionals.books: My dear children, for whom I am again in the pains of childbirth until Christ is formed in you. - Galatians 4:19

devotionals.title: Called to Freedom
devotionals.devotionalText:
You, my brothers and sisters, were called to be free. But do not use your freedom to indulge the flesh; rather, serve one another humbly in love. Called to freedom. Free to serve. Free to love.

	You were called to be free. Freedom is your calling. Liberty is your destiny. You weren't saved for bondage but for freedom.

	But do not use your freedom to indulge the flesh. Freedom isn't license to sin. It's power over sin. Freedom serves a purpose.

	Rather, serve one another humbly in love. Freedom enables service. Liberty empowers love. You're free to serve, not free to be selfish.

	For the entire law is fulfilled in keeping this one command: 'Love your neighbor as yourself.' Love fulfills law. One command covers everything.

	If you bite and devour each other, watch out or you will be destroyed by each other. Misused freedom destroys. Selfish liberty devours.

	So I say, walk by the Spirit, and you will not gratify the desires of the flesh. The solution: walk by the Spirit.

	You're called to freedom. Use it to love and serve, not to indulge and destroy.

	Father, I'm called to freedom! Help me use my freedom to serve others in love, not to indulge my flesh. I walk by the Spirit and fulfill the law through love. I'm free to serve! Amen.
devotionals.books: You, my brothers and sisters, were called to be free. But do not use your freedom to indulge the flesh; rather, serve one another humbly in love. - Galatians 5:13

devotionals.title: Live by the Spirit
devotionals.devotionalText:
Since we live by the Spirit, let us keep in step with the Spirit. Living by the Spirit means walking in step with Him. Match His pace. Follow His lead.

	Since we live by the Spirit. Your life source is the Spirit. You don't live by flesh anymore. The Spirit gives you life.

	Let us keep in step with the Spirit. Stay in rhythm. Don't run ahead. Don't lag behind. Keep pace with the Spirit.

	The acts of the flesh are obvious. Flesh produces visible destruction. Sexual immorality, impurity, debaucheryâ€”flesh destroys.

	But the fruit of the Spirit is love. Spirit produces love first. Everything else flows from love.

	Joy, peace, forbearance, kindness, goodness. These aren't forcedâ€”they're fruit. Natural production of the Spirit's life in you.

	Faithfulness, gentleness and self-control. Character qualities. Spirit fruit. Evidence of Spirit life.

	Against such things there is no law. No law condemns Spirit fruit. Law can't improve on what the Spirit produces.

	Live by the Spirit. Walk by the Spirit. Keep in step with the Spirit. Let Him lead.

	Holy Spirit, I live by You! Help me keep in step with Youâ€”matching Your pace, following Your lead. Produce Your fruit in me. I live and walk by You! Amen.
devotionals.books: Since we live by the Spirit, let us keep in step with the Spirit. - Galatians 5:25

devotionals.title: Bear One Another's Burdens
devotionals.devotionalText:
Carry each other's burdens, and in this way you will fulfill the law of Christ. Burden-bearing fulfills Christ's law. Love carries weight. Grace helps others.

	Carry each other's burdens. Not your burdens only. Each other's burdens. Mutual support. Shared weight.

	And in this way you will fulfill the law of Christ. Christ's law is love. Love bears burdens. Carrying others fulfills love.

	If anyone thinks they are something when they are not, they deceive themselves. Pride prevents burden-bearing. Humility helps others.

	Each one should test their own actions. Examine yourself, not others. Check your own heart before judging others.

	Then they can take pride in themselves alone, without comparing themselves to someone else. Healthy pride comes from faithfulness, not comparison.

	For each one should carry their own load. Personal responsibility remains. You help others while handling your own responsibilities.

	Nevertheless, the one who receives instruction in the word should share all good things with their instructor. Blessing should flow both ways.

	Love bears burdens. Grace shares weight. This fulfills Christ's law.

	Father, help me carry others' burdens! This is how I fulfill Christ's law of love. Keep me humble enough to help and strong enough to bear weight. I carry burdens in love! Amen.
devotionals.books: Carry each other's burdens, and in this way you will fulfill the law of Christ. - Galatians 6:2

devotionals.title: A New Creation
devotionals.devotionalText:
Neither circumcision nor uncircumcision means anything; what counts is the new creation. Religion doesn't matter. Rituals don't count. Being new in Christ is everything.

	Neither circumcision nor uncircumcision means anything. External marks don't matter. Religious rituals are meaningless. Performance doesn't save.

	What counts is the new creation. This is what matters. Being new. Being transformed. Being recreated in Christ.

	Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come. Has come. Already here. You're not becoming newâ€”you ARE new.

	The old has gone, the new is here! Old is gone. Finished. Dead. New is here. Present. Alive.

	All this is from God, who reconciled us to himself through Christ. God did this. God made you new. God reconciled you.

	And gave us the ministry of reconciliation. You're not just reconciledâ€”you're a reconciler. You bring others to God.

	You're a new creation. The old you is dead. The new you is alive. This is what counts.

	Father, I'm a new creation in Christ! The old has gone, the new has come. Thank You for making me completely new. Religion doesn't matterâ€”being new in You is everything! Amen.
devotionals.books: Neither circumcision nor uncircumcision means anything; what counts is the new creation. - Galatians 6:15

devotionals.title: Peace and Mercy
devotionals.devotionalText:
Peace and mercy to all who follow this ruleâ€”to the Israel of God. Peace and mercy follow those who live as new creations. Walk by this rule.

	Peace and mercy to all who follow this rule. The rule of new creation. Living from new identity. Walking in new life.

	To the Israel of God. God's true people. Not ethnic Israel only, but spiritual Israel. All who belong to God through faith.

	From now on, let no one cause me trouble, for I bear on my body the marks of Jesus. Paul bore Jesus' marksâ€”suffering scars for the gospel.

	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Grace with your spirit. Not just with youâ€”with your spirit. Deep grace.

	Brothers and sisters. Amen. Family language. We're brothers and sisters in Christ. One family under grace.

	May the God of peace himself sanctify you completely. God's peace sanctifies. Makes holy. Completes the work.

	Peace and mercy are yours when you walk as a new creation. This is your inheritance.

	Father, I receive Your peace and mercy! I follow the rule of new creationâ€”living from my new identity in Christ. Let Your grace be with my spirit. Sanctify me completely! Amen.
devotionals.books: Peace and mercy to all who follow this ruleâ€”to the Israel of God. - Galatians 6:16

devotionals.title: Grace Be with Your Spirit
devotionals.devotionalText:
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit, brothers and sisters. Amen. Grace doesn't just touch youâ€”it's with your spirit. Deep, internal, permanent grace.

	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ. Jesus' grace. Not generic grace. Personal grace from your Lord and Savior.

	Be with your spirit. Not just your mind. Not just your emotions. Your spiritâ€”the deepest part of you.

	Brothers and sisters. Family terms. You're not alone. You're part of God's family. Brothers and sisters in grace.

	Amen. So be it. Let it be so. Agreement with grace. Acceptance of grace. Affirmation of grace.

	May the Lord make your love increase and overflow for each other. Growing love. Overflowing love. Love that keeps expanding.

	And for everyone else, so that he may strengthen your hearts. Love strengthens hearts. Makes you stable. Establishes you.

	Grace isn't surface-level. It goes deep. It touches your spirit. It transforms from within.

	Jesus, let Your grace be with my spirit! Not just my circumstances, but my deepest self. I'm Your brother/sister in the family of grace. Amenâ€”so be it! Amen.
devotionals.books: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit, brothers and sisters. Amen. - Galatians 6:18

devotionals.title: Complete in Him
devotionals.devotionalText:
For in Christ all the fullness of the Deity lives in bodily form, and in Christ you have been brought to fullness. All of God lives in Christ. And you're complete in Him.

	For in Christ all the fullness of the Deity lives. All of God. Complete deity. Full divinity. Nothing lacking in Christ.

	In bodily form. God became flesh. Deity took on humanity. The infinite became finite without losing infinity.

	And in Christ you have been brought to fullness. You're full. Complete. Whole. Lacking nothing in Christ.

	He is the head over every power and authority. Christ rules everything. Every power bows. Every authority submits.

	In him you were also circumcised with a circumcision not performed by human hands. Spiritual circumcision. Heart surgery. Inner transformation.

	Your whole self ruled by the flesh was put off. The flesh nature was cut away. Removed. Discarded.

	When you were circumcised by Christ. Christ performed spiritual surgery on you. He removed what needed removing.

	You're complete in Christ. Full. Whole. Everything you need is in Him.

	Jesus, all the fullness of God lives in You, and I'm complete in You! I lack nothing. You are head over every power, and You've made me full. I'm complete! Amen.
devotionals.books: For in Christ all the fullness of the Deity lives in bodily form, and in Christ you have been brought to fullness. He is the head over every power and authority. - Colossians 2:9-10

devotionals.title: Buried and Raised with Christ
devotionals.devotionalText:
Having been buried with him in baptism, in which you were also raised with him through your faith in the working of God, who raised him from the dead. Buried with Him. Raised with Him. Your story is His story.

	Having been buried with him in baptism. When Christ was buried, you were buried. Your baptism pictures this spiritual reality.

	In which you were also raised with him. When Christ rose, you rose. His resurrection is your resurrection. You share His victory.

	Through your faith in the working of God. Faith connects you to God's power. You believe in God's working, not your own.

	Who raised him from the dead. The same God who raised Jesus raised you. Same power. Same victory. Same new life.

	When you were dead in your sins and in the uncircumcision of your flesh, God made you alive with Christ. Dead to alive. Instant transformation.

	He forgave us all our sins. All sins. Not some. Not most. All. Complete forgiveness. Total cleansing.

	You died with Christ. You were buried with Christ. You were raised with Christ. This is your identity.

	Father, I was buried and raised with Christ! Thank You for making me alive when I was dead in sins. All my sins are forgiven. I share Christ's death, burial, and resurrection! Amen.
devotionals.books: Having been buried with him in baptism, in which you were also raised with him through your faith in the working of God, who raised him from the dead. - Colossians 2:12

devotionals.title: He Canceled the Debt
devotionals.devotionalText:
Having canceled the charge of our legal indebtedness, which stood against us and condemned us; he has taken it away, nailing it to the cross. Your debt is canceled. The charges dropped. The case closed.

	Having canceled the charge of our legal indebtedness. You owed a debt you couldn't pay. Christ paid a debt He didn't owe.

	Which stood against us and condemned us. The law condemned you. The charges were real. The guilt was legitimate.

	He has taken it away. Not hidden. Not ignored. Taken away. Removed. Gone. Your debt doesn't exist anymore.

	Nailing it to the cross. Your debt was nailed to Christ's cross. He took your charges. He bore your punishment.

	And having disarmed the powers and authorities, he made a public spectacle of them. Satan's power is broken. Demon forces are defeated.

	Triumphing over them by the cross. The cross wasn't defeatâ€”it was victory. Not tragedyâ€”triumph.

	Your spiritual debt is paid in full. The charges against you are dropped. You're free.

	Jesus, You canceled my debt! Thank You for taking away every charge against me and nailing it to Your cross. You triumphed over every power that condemned me. I'm debt-free! Amen.
devotionals.books: Having canceled the charge of our legal indebtedness, which stood against us and condemned us; he has taken it away, nailing it to the cross. - Colossians 2:14

devotionals.title: Let No One Judge You
devotionals.devotionalText:
Therefore do not let anyone judge you by what you eat or drink, or with regard to a religious festival, a New Moon celebration or a Sabbath day. Don't let others judge your freedom. You're not under law but grace.

	Therefore do not let anyone judge you. Don't allow it. Don't accept it. Don't receive judgment from those who don't understand grace.

	By what you eat or drink. Food doesn't make you spiritual. Drink doesn't determine your standing. You're free from food laws.

	Or with regard to a religious festival. Religious holidays don't save you. Special days don't sanctify you. You're free from religious calendars.

	A New Moon celebration or a Sabbath day. Old covenant observances don't apply. You're under new covenant freedom.

	These are a shadow of the things that were to come. Shadows point to substance. The substance is Christ.

	The reality, however, is found in Christ. Christ is the reality. Not rules. Not regulations. Christ Himself.

	Don't let anyone judge your freedom in Christ. You're not bound by others' religious rules.

	Jesus, I won't let anyone judge my freedom in You! Religious rules don't determine my standingâ€”You do. You are the reality, not the shadow. I'm free from judgment! Amen.
devotionals.books: Therefore do not let anyone judge you by what you eat or drink, or with regard to a religious festival, a New Moon celebration or a Sabbath day. These are a shadow of the things that were to come; the reality, however, is found in Christ. - Colossians 2:16-17

devotionals.title: You Died with Christ
devotionals.devotionalText:
Since you died with Christ to the elemental spiritual forces of this world, why, as though you still belonged to the world, do you submit to its rules? You died to the world's system. Stop living by its rules.

	Since you died with Christ. Past tense. You already died. When Christ died, you died with Him.

	To the elemental spiritual forces of this world. Basic principles. Elementary rules. Religious ABCs. You graduated from that.

	Why, as though you still belonged to the world. You don't belong to the world anymore. You belong to Christ.

	Do you submit to its rules? Why follow dead rules when you have new life? Why obey what you died to?

	'Do not handle! Do not taste! Do not touch!' Religious rules. External regulations. Surface spirituality.

	These rules, which have to do with things that are all destined to perish. Temporary rules about temporary things.

	Such regulations indeed have an appearance of wisdom. They look spiritual but lack power.

	You died with Christ. You're free from religious rules. Live from your new life, not old law.

	Jesus, I died with You to the world's system! I don't belong to religious rules anymore. I belong to You. Help me live from new life, not old regulations. I'm dead to rules, alive to You! Amen.
devotionals.books: Since you died with Christ to the elemental spiritual forces of this world, why, as though you still belonged to the world, do you submit to its rules: 'Do not handle! Do not taste! Do not touch!'? - Colossians 2:20-21

devotionals.title: Set Your Hearts on Things Above
devotionals.devotionalText:
Since, then, you have been raised with Christ, set your hearts on things above, where Christ is, seated at the right hand of God. You're raised with Christ. Think from heaven's perspective.

	Since, then, you have been raised with Christ. You've been raised. Past tense. Your resurrection already happened spiritually.

	Set your hearts on things above. Heart focus. Affection direction. Let your heart seek heavenly things.

	Where Christ is, seated at the right hand of God. Christ's location is your focus. He's seated in victory, and that's your perspective.

	Set your minds on things above, not on earthly things. Mind setting. Thought direction. Think from heaven's viewpoint.

	For you died, and your life is now hidden with Christ in God. You died. Your new life is hidden. Protected. Secured in Christ.

	When Christ, who is your life, appears, then you also will appear with him in glory. Christ IS your life. When He appears, you appear.

	Think from heaven. Live from heaven. You're raised with Christâ€”act like it.

	Jesus, I'm raised with You! Help me set my heart and mind on things above, not earthly things. You are my life, hidden in God. I think from heaven's perspective! Amen.
devotionals.books: Since, then, you have been raised with Christ, set your hearts on things above, where Christ is, seated at the right hand of God. Set your minds on things above, not on earthly things. - Colossians 3:1-2

devotionals.title: Put to Death What Is Earthly
devotionals.devotionalText:
Put to death, therefore, whatever belongs to your earthly nature: sexual immorality, impurity, lust, evil desires and greed, which is idolatry. Kill what needs to die. Your earthly nature doesn't belong in your heavenly life.

	Put to death, therefore. Active choice. Decisive action. You have the power to kill what needs to die.

	Whatever belongs to your earthly nature. Old nature patterns. Flesh habits. Pre-Christ behaviors. They must die.

	Sexual immorality, impurity, lust. Sexual sins. Bodily sins. These don't fit your new identity.

	Evil desires and greed, which is idolatry. Wrong wants. Selfish cravings. Greed equals idolatryâ€”worshiping things instead of God.

	Because of these, the wrath of God is coming. These behaviors bring judgment. They lead to destruction.

	You used to walk in these ways, in the life you once lived. Past tense. Used to. Once lived. Not anymore.

	But now you must also rid yourselves of all such things. Complete removal. Total elimination. All must go.

	Your new life requires the death of old patterns. Kill what doesn't belong.

	Father, I put to death everything from my earthly nature! Help me kill what needs to die. I used to walk in those ways, but not anymore. I choose life over death! Amen.
devotionals.books: Put to death, therefore, whatever belongs to your earthly nature: sexual immorality, impurity, lust, evil desires and greed, which is idolatry. - Colossians 3:5

devotionals.title: Clothed with Christ
devotionals.devotionalText:
Do not lie to each other, since you have taken off your old self with its practices and have put on the new self, which is being renewed in knowledge in the image of its Creator. Old self off. New self on. Like changing clothes.

	Do not lie to each other. Truth between believers. Honesty in the family. Lies don't fit the new self.

	Since you have taken off your old self. Past tense. Already done. The old self is off like dirty clothes.

	With its practices. Old behaviors. Former habits. Previous patterns. All removed with the old self.

	And have put on the new self. New self is on. Like putting on clean clothes. You're wearing your new identity.

	Which is being renewed in knowledge. Continuous renewal. Ongoing transformation. Growing knowledge of God.

	In the image of its Creator. You're being renewed into God's image. Transformed to look like your Creator.

	Here there is no Gentile or Jew, circumcised or uncircumcised. No divisions. No categories. All are one in Christ.

	You've changed clothes spiritually. Old self off, new self on.

	Father, I've taken off my old self and put on the new! Thank You for renewing me in knowledge, transforming me into Your image. I wear my new identity like new clothes! Amen.
devotionals.books: Do not lie to each other, since you have taken off your old self with its practices and have put on the new self, which is being renewed in knowledge in the image of its Creator. - Colossians 3:9-10

devotionals.title: God's Chosen People
devotionals.devotionalText:
Therefore, as God's chosen people, holy and dearly loved, clothe yourselves with compassion, kindness, humility, gentleness and patience. You're chosen, holy, loved. Dress accordingly.

	As God's chosen people. Chosen by God. Selected. Picked. You're not randomâ€”you're chosen.

	Holy and dearly loved. Set apart and deeply loved. Sacred and cherished. Holy doesn't mean perfectâ€”it means set apart for God.

	Clothe yourselves with compassion. Put on compassion like clothing. Wear mercy. Dress in care for others.

	Kindness, humility, gentleness and patience. Your spiritual wardrobe. These qualities should cover you.

	Bear with each other and forgive one another. Patience with people. Quick forgiveness. Grace in relationships.

	If any of you has a grievance against someone. When hurt happensâ€”and it willâ€”forgive.

	Forgive as the Lord forgave you. The same way. The same measure. Complete forgiveness.

	You're chosen, holy, and dearly loved. That's your identity. Now dress like it.

	Father, I'm Your chosen, holy, dearly loved child! Help me clothe myself with compassion, kindness, humility, gentleness, and patience. I forgive as You forgave me. I dress according to my identity! Amen.
devotionals.books: Therefore, as God's chosen people, holy and dearly loved, clothe yourselves with compassion, kindness, humility, gentleness and patience. Bear with each other and forgive one another if any of you has a grievance against someone. Forgive as the Lord forgave you. - Colossians 3:12-13

devotionals.title: Let the Peace of Christ Rule
devotionals.devotionalText:
Let the peace of Christ rule in your hearts, since as members of one body you were called to peace. And be thankful. Christ's peace should rule your heart. It's your umpire for decisions.

	Let the peace of Christ rule. Let peace be the decision-maker. The umpire. The final authority in your heart.

	In your hearts. Internal peace. Heart peace. Not just external calm but internal rule.

	Since as members of one body you were called to peace. Peace is your calling. You're designed for peace. Created for harmony.

	And be thankful. Gratitude accompanies peace. Thankfulness guards peace. Grateful hearts maintain peace.

	Let the message of Christ dwell among you richly. Christ's word should live in you abundantly. Rich indwelling of truth.

	As you teach and admonish one another with all wisdom. Share wisdom. Teach truth. Build each other up.

	Through psalms, hymns, and songs from the Spirit. Worship flows from peaceful hearts. Songs rise from grateful spirits.

	Let peace rule. Let gratitude flow. Let Christ's word dwell richly.

	Jesus, let Your peace rule in my heart! I'm called to peace as a member of Your body. Fill me with gratitude and let Your message dwell in me richly. Your peace is my umpire! Amen.
devotionals.books: Let the peace of Christ rule in your hearts, since as members of one body you were called to peace. And be thankful. - Colossians 3:15

devotionals.title: Do Everything in Jesus' Name
devotionals.devotionalText:
And whatever you do, whether in word or deed, do it all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him. Everything in Jesus' name. Every word. Every action. All for Him.

	Whatever you do. Everything. No exceptions. Every activity. Every conversation. Every decision.

	Whether in word or deed. What you say and what you do. Speech and action. Words and works.

	Do it all in the name of the Lord Jesus. His name authorizes your actions. His reputation backs your behavior.

	Giving thanks to God the Father through him. Gratitude accompanies everything. Thanks flows through Jesus to the Father.

	Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart. Wholehearted effort. Complete commitment. Full engagement.

	As working for the Lord, not for human masters. Your real boss is Jesus. You work for Him, not just people.

	Since you know that you will receive an inheritance from the Lord as a reward. Your work has eternal value. Heavenly reward awaits.

	Everything becomes worship when done in Jesus' name.

	Jesus, I do everything in Your name! Every word, every deed, all for You. Help me work wholeheartedly as for You, not people. Thank You that everything has eternal value when done in Your name! Amen.
devotionals.books: And whatever you do, whether in word or deed, do it all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him. - Colossians 3:17

devotionals.title: The Lord's Reward
devotionals.devotionalText:
Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for human masters, since you know that you will receive an inheritance from the Lord as a reward. Your work matters to God. He sees. He rewards.

	Whatever you do. Every task. Every job. Every responsibility. Nothing is too small for God to notice.

	Work at it with all your heart. Wholehearted work. Full effort. Complete dedication. Half-hearted work dishonors God.

	As working for the Lord. He's your real employer. Your true boss. Your ultimate supervisor.

	Not for human masters. People aren't your final authority. Their approval isn't your ultimate goal.

	Since you know that you will receive an inheritance. Your reward is coming. Your inheritance is guaranteed.

	From the Lord as a reward. God Himself rewards you. Not people. Not companies. The Lord rewards.

	It is the Lord Christ you are serving. Present tense. Right now. In your current work, you serve Christ.

	Your work has eternal significance because you work for an eternal King.

	Lord Jesus, I work for You! Help me work wholeheartedly, knowing You see and reward everything. My inheritance comes from You. Every task is service to You. I work for eternal reward! Amen.
devotionals.books: Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for human masters, since you know that you will receive an inheritance from the Lord as a reward. It is the Lord Christ you are serving. - Colossians 3:23-24

devotionals.title: Living Your True Identity
devotionals.devotionalText:
Since you have been raised with Christ, set your hearts on things above. For you died, and your life is now hidden with Christ in God. When Christ, who is your life, appears, then you also will appear with him in glory. This is who you areâ€”raised, hidden, glorified.

	Since you have been raised with Christ. Your resurrection is complete. You're not waiting to be raisedâ€”you ARE raised.

	Set your hearts on things above. Let heaven capture your affection. Let eternity shape your priorities.

	For you died. Your old life ended at the cross. That person you used to be no longer exists.

	And your life is now hidden with Christ in God. Double protection. Hidden IN Christ who is IN God. Ultimate security.

	When Christ, who is your life. Christ isn't part of your lifeâ€”He IS your life. Your breath, your purpose, your everything.

	Appears, then you also will appear with him in glory. Your glory is guaranteed. When He's revealed, you're revealed.

	This is your true identity: dead to the old, alive in the new, hidden in Christ, destined for glory.

	Live from this truth every day.

	Jesus, You are my life! I'm raised with You, hidden in You, and will appear with You in glory. Help me live from this true identity every single day. My life is hidden with You in God! Amen.
devotionals.books: Since, then, you have been raised with Christ, set your hearts on things above, where Christ is, seated at the right hand of God. For you died, and your life is now hidden with Christ in God. When Christ, who is your life, appears, then you also will appear with him in glory. - Colossians 3:1, 3-4

devotionals.title: Christ Is All and Is in All
devotionals.devotionalText:
Here there is no Gentile or Jew, circumcised or uncircumcised, barbarian, Scythian, slave or free, but Christ is all, and is in all. In Christ, all divisions disappear. He is everything and in everyone.

	No Gentile or Jew. Racial divisions erased. Ethnic barriers broken. In Christ, race doesn't divide.

	Circumcised or uncircumcised. Religious divisions gone. Ritual differences irrelevant. In Christ, religion doesn't separate.

	Barbarian, Scythian. Cultural divisions dissolved. Social classes eliminated. In Christ, culture doesn't classify.

	Slave or free. Economic divisions destroyed. Status differences meaningless. In Christ, position doesn't matter.

	But Christ is all. He's everything that matters. The only identity that counts. The supreme reality.

	And is in all. Christ lives in every believer. Same Spirit. Same life. Same Lord in everyone.

	This is the new humanityâ€”no divisions, only Christ. You're part of this unified body where Christ is everything.

	Jesus, You are all and in all! Thank You for erasing every division and making us one. Help me see others through Your eyes, not through cultural or racial lenses. You are everything! Amen.
devotionals.books: Here there is no Gentile or Jew, circumcised or uncircumcised, barbarian, Scythian, slave or free, but Christ is all, and is in all. - Colossians 3:11

devotionals.title: Above All, Put on Love
devotionals.devotionalText:
And over all these virtues put on love, which binds them all together in perfect unity. Love is the outer garment that holds everything together.

	And over all these virtues. On top of everything else. The final piece. The completing element.

	Put on love. Like putting on a coat. Love covers everything. Love completes your spiritual outfit.

	Which binds them all together. Love is the glue. The connector. The force that unites all other virtues.

	In perfect unity. Complete harmony. Total oneness. Love creates perfect unity among believers.

	Beyond all these things put on love. Love isn't optional. It's essential. The most important virtue to wear.

	Which is the perfect bond of unity. Love perfects relationships. Makes unity possible. Creates lasting bonds.

	Without love, other virtues fall apart. With love, everything holds together. Love completes your transformation.

	Father, I put on love above all else! Help me wear love as my outer garment, binding all virtues together. Let Your love flow through me to create perfect unity. Love completes me! Amen.
devotionals.books: And over all these virtues put on love, which binds them all together in perfect unity. - Colossians 3:14

devotionals.title: The Word of Christ Dwelling Richly
devotionals.devotionalText:
Let the message of Christ dwell among you richly as you teach and admonish one another with all wisdom through psalms, hymns, and songs from the Spirit, singing to God with gratitude in your hearts. Christ's word should overflow in you.

	Let the message of Christ dwell among you richly. Not poorly. Richly. Abundantly. Overflowing with Christ's word.

	Dwell. Take up residence. Make its home. Settle in permanently. The word lives in you.

	As you teach and admonish one another. Share truth. Correct gently. Build each other up with wisdom.

	With all wisdom. Not partial wisdom. Complete wisdom. The word gives you wisdom for every situation.

	Through psalms, hymns, and songs from the Spirit. Worship flows from word-filled hearts. Songs rise from scripture-soaked souls.

	Singing to God with gratitude in your hearts. Grateful hearts sing. Thankful spirits worship. Gratitude creates melody.

	The word of Christ isn't just informationâ€”it's transformation. Let it dwell richly.

	Jesus, let Your message dwell in me richly! Fill me to overflowing with Your word. Help me teach and encourage others with wisdom. Let worship and gratitude flow from my word-filled heart! Amen.
devotionals.books: Let the message of Christ dwell among you richly as you teach and admonish one another with all wisdom through psalms, hymns, and songs from the Spirit, singing to God with gratitude in your hearts. - Colossians 3:16

devotionals.title: Continue in Prayer
devotionals.devotionalText:
Devote yourselves to prayer, being watchful and thankful. Prayer isn't occasionalâ€”it's devotional. Stay alert. Stay grateful.

	Devote yourselves to prayer. Give yourself to prayer. Commit to prayer. Make prayer your lifestyle.

	Being watchful. Stay alert. Keep your eyes open. Prayer requires spiritual alertness.

	And thankful. Gratitude accompanies prayer. Thanks guards your heart. Appreciation shapes your requests.

	And pray for us, too, that God may open a door for our message. Prayer opens doors. Creates opportunities. Makes ways.

	So that we may proclaim the mystery of Christ. Prayer enables proclamation. Opens mouths. Gives boldness.

	Pray that I may proclaim it clearly, as I should. Clear communication. Bold declaration. Prayer helps others speak truth.

	Be wise in the way you act toward outsiders. Wisdom with unbelievers. Careful conduct. Strategic living.

	Make the most of every opportunity. Maximize moments. Seize chances. Prayer helps you recognize opportunities.

	Prayer is your lifeline. Devote yourself to it.

	Father, I devote myself to prayer! Help me stay watchful and thankful. Open doors for Your message through my prayers. Make me wise with outsiders and help me maximize every opportunity. I'm devoted to prayer! Amen.
devotionals.books: Devote yourselves to prayer, being watchful and thankful. And pray for us, too, that God may open a door for our message, so that we may proclaim the mystery of Christ. - Colossians 4:2-3

devotionals.title: Seasoned with Salt
devotionals.devotionalText:
Let your conversation be always full of grace, seasoned with salt, so that you may know how to answer everyone. Your words should be gracious and flavorful.

	Let your conversation be always full of grace. Always. Not sometimes. Every conversation gracious. Every word kind.

	Seasoned with salt. Salt adds flavor. Preserves goodness. Your words should enhance, not destroy.

	So that you may know how to answer everyone. Wisdom in responses. Appropriate answers. Grace gives you the right words.

	Conduct yourselves wisely toward outsiders. Your behavior matters. Unbelievers are watching. Live strategically.

	Making the best use of the time. Time is precious. Opportunities are limited. Use time wisely.

	Your speech always gracious. Consistent grace. Reliable kindness. Dependable gentleness in words.

	Words have power. Use them to build up. Season them with grace and wisdom.

	Father, let my conversation always be full of grace! Season my words with saltâ€”making them flavorful and preserving. Help me know how to answer everyone with wisdom and grace. My words matter! Amen.
devotionals.books: Let your conversation be always full of grace, seasoned with salt, so that you may know how to answer everyone. - Colossians 4:6

devotionals.title: God's Elect, Holy and Beloved
devotionals.devotionalText:
Put on then, as God's chosen ones, holy and beloved, compassionate hearts, kindness, humility, meekness, and patience. You're chosen, holy, and beloved. Dress accordingly.

	As God's chosen ones. Hand-picked by God. Selected. Chosen. You're not accidentalâ€”you're intentional.

	Holy and beloved. Set apart and deeply loved. Sacred and cherished. Both holy and loved.

	Compassionate hearts. Tender care. Deep empathy. Hearts that feel others' pain.

	Kindness. Gentle goodness. Practical love. Actions that help and heal.

	Humility. Proper self-view. Not thinking too highly or lowly of yourself. Accurate identity.

	Meekness. Strength under control. Power with restraint. Gentleness by choice.

	And patience. Long-suffering. Slow to anger. Endurance with difficult people.

	Bearing with one another. Putting up with quirks. Tolerating differences. Love covers.

	You're God's electâ€”chosen, holy, beloved. These qualities flow from that identity.

	Father, I'm Your chosen one, holy and beloved! Help me put on compassion, kindness, humility, meekness, and patience. These qualities match my identity. I dress according to who You say I am! Amen.
devotionals.books: Put on then, as God's chosen ones, holy and beloved, compassionate hearts, kindness, humility, meekness, and patience, bearing with one another. - Colossians 3:12-13

devotionals.title: If God Is for Us
devotionals.devotionalText:
What then shall we say to these things? If God is for us, who can be against us? This isn't a questionâ€”it's a declaration. God is for you!

	If God is for us. Not if God tolerates us. FOR us. Actively supporting. Powerfully backing. Completely committed.

	Who can be against us? The answer is no one who matters. If God is for you, opposition is already defeated.

	He who did not spare his own Son. God held nothing back. Gave His most precious. His best for you.

	But delivered him up for us all. For everyone. Including you. Personal delivery. Individual sacrifice.

	How will he not also with him freely give us all things? Logic demands it. If He gave Jesus, He'll give everything else.

	Who shall bring a charge against God's elect? No valid accusation stands. God justified you.

	It is God who justifies. The Judge declared you righteous. Case closed. Verdict final.

	God is for you. That changes everything. Opposition doesn't stand a chance.

	Father, You are FOR me! If You're for me, no one can stand against me. Thank You for not sparing Your Son but giving Him for me. With Him, You freely give me all things. You are for me! Amen.
devotionals.books: What then shall we say to these things? If God is for us, who can be against us? He who did not spare his own Son but delivered him up for us all, how will he not also with him freely give us all things? - Romans 8:31-32

devotionals.title: Who Shall Separate Us?
devotionals.devotionalText:
Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall tribulation, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or danger, or sword? Nothing can separate you from His love.

	Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Paul searches for something that could. He can't find it.

	Shall tribulation? Troubles can't separate you. Hardship doesn't break the bond. Difficulty doesn't divide.

	Or distress? Stress can't do it. Pressure doesn't break love's grip. Anxiety doesn't separate.

	Or persecution? Opposition can't separate. Attacks don't divide. Persecution can't break love's hold.

	Or famine, or nakedness? Lack doesn't separate. Poverty doesn't divide. Need doesn't break the bond.

	Or danger, or sword? Threats can't do it. Death itself can't separate you from Christ's love.

	No, in all these things we are more than conquerors. Not just conquerors. MORE than conquerors.

	Through him who loved us. His love makes you victorious. Love is your conquering power.

	Nothing can separate you from the love of Christ. Absolutely nothing.

	Jesus, nothing can separate me from Your love! Not trouble, stress, persecution, lack, or danger. In all these things, I'm more than a conqueror through Your love. I'm inseparable from You! Amen.
devotionals.books: Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall tribulation, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or danger, or sword? No, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him who loved us. - Romans 8:35, 37

devotionals.title: Neither Death Nor Life
devotionals.devotionalText:
For I am sure that neither death nor life, neither angels nor demons, neither the present nor the future, nor any powers, neither height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God. Absolutely nothing can separate you.

	For I am sure. Paul is convinced. Certain. Absolutely confident. This isn't wishful thinking.

	Neither death nor life. Death can't separate. Life can't divide. Neither state breaks the bond.

	Neither angels nor demons. Heavenly beings can't separate. Demonic forces can't divide. No spiritual power can break it.

	Neither the present nor the future. Time can't separate. Current problems or future fears can't divide.

	Nor any powers. No authority. No force. No power in existence can separate you.

	Neither height nor depth. No dimension can divide. No distance can separate. Nothing spatial can break the bond.

	Nor anything else in all creation. Paul covers everything. All creation combined can't separate you from God's love.

	This love is unbreakable, unshakeable, unstoppable.

	Father, I'm convinced that nothing can separate me from Your love! Not death, life, angels, demons, present, future, height, depthâ€”nothing in all creation. Your love for me is absolutely unbreakable! Amen.
devotionals.books: For I am sure that neither death nor life, neither angels nor demons, neither the present nor the future, nor any powers, neither height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God in Christ Jesus our Lord. - Romans 8:38-39

devotionals.title: Walk in a Manner Worthy
devotionals.devotionalText:
I therefore, a prisoner for the Lord, urge you to walk in a manner worthy of the calling to which you have been called. Your walk should match your calling.

	A prisoner for the Lord. Paul writes from prison but he's free. Physical chains can't bind spiritual freedom.

	Urge you to walk in a manner worthy. Strong encouragement. Passionate plea. Your walk matters.

	Of the calling to which you have been called. You have a calling. A divine purpose. Walk worthy of it.

	With all humility and gentleness. How to walk worthyâ€”humbly, gently. Not proudly or harshly.

	With patience, bearing with one another in love. Patient with people. Love covers offenses. Grace endures.

	Eager to maintain the unity of the Spirit. Unity already exists. Your job is maintaining it, not creating it.

	In the bond of peace. Peace binds believers together. Unity and peace go hand in hand.

	Your calling is high. Walk worthy of it.

	Father, help me walk worthy of my calling! With humility, gentleness, patience, and love. I'm eager to maintain unity and peace. My walk will match my calling! Amen.
devotionals.books: I therefore, a prisoner for the Lord, urge you to walk in a manner worthy of the calling to which you have been called, with all humility and gentleness, with patience, bearing with one another in love, eager to maintain the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace. - Ephesians 4:1-3

devotionals.title: Grace Given to Each One
devotionals.devotionalText:
But grace was given to each one of us according to the measure of Christ's gift. Every believer receives grace. Christ measures it perfectly.

	Grace was given to each one of us. Every single believer. No exceptions. You received grace.

	According to the measure of Christ's gift. Christ determines the measure. He distributes perfectly. Right amount for you.

	Therefore it says, 'When he ascended on high he led a host of captives, and he gave gifts to men.' Victory procession. Gifts distributed.

	He who descended is the one who also ascended. Same Jesus. Went down to death, up to glory.

	Far above all the heavens, that he might fill all things. Complete authority. Total dominion. Filling everything.

	And he gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the shepherds and teachers. Different gifts for different people.

	To equip the saints for the work of ministry. Gifts equip others. Your grace serves the body.

	You received grace according to Christ's perfect measure. Use it.

	Jesus, You gave me grace according to Your perfect measure! Thank You for equipping me with exactly what I need. Help me use my grace gift to serve others. You measured perfectly! Amen.
devotionals.books: But grace was given to each one of us according to the measure of Christ's gift. - Ephesians 4:7

devotionals.title: Building Up the Body
devotionals.devotionalText:
For building up the body of Christ, until we all attain to the unity of the faith and of the knowledge of the Son of God, to mature manhood. Building up, not tearing down. Growing toward maturity together.

	For building up the body of Christ. Construction, not destruction. Edification, not demolition. Building is the goal.

	Until we all attain to the unity of the faith. Moving toward unity. Growing in oneness. Faith unites us.

	And of the knowledge of the Son of God. Knowing Jesus better. Deeper relationship. Fuller understanding.

	To mature manhood. Spiritual adulthood. Full growth. Complete development in Christ.

	To the measure of the stature of the fullness of Christ. Christ is the standard. His fullness is the goal.

	So that we may no longer be children. Spiritual babies need to grow. Maturity is expected.

	Tossed to and fro by the waves. Instability from immaturity. Maturity brings steadiness.

	You're being built up with others into maturity. Keep growing.

	Father, build me up with other believers! Help us attain unity, knowledge of Jesus, and spiritual maturity. I want to reach the fullness of Christ. Keep building me! Amen.
devotionals.books: For building up the body of Christ, until we all attain to the unity of the faith and of the knowledge of the Son of God, to mature manhood, to the measure of the stature of the fullness of Christ. - Ephesians 4:12-13

devotionals.title: Speaking Truth in Love
devotionals.devotionalText:
Rather, speaking the truth in love, we are to grow up in every way into him who is the head, into Christ. Truth and love together. Both are necessary.

	Speaking the truth in love. Not truth without loveâ€”that's harsh. Not love without truthâ€”that's deception. Both together.
